column8: Notes
Lamming is born
Goes to Trinidad as a teacher at Colegio de Venezuela
Leaves for England on the same ship as novelist Sam Selvon.  Lamming will be based in London until the late 1970s
date ambiguous for this visit
Goes to Ibiza to visit the Canadian writer Mordecai Richler
Travel in connection with Gugghenheim Foundation fellowship. Stays on Riverside Drive with frequent visits to Harlem

Visits Howard University. Could be early 1956. He stays for a week

First Congress of Black Writers and Artists. Lamming gives the speech "The Negro Writer and his World" on September 21, 1956

Writes most of Of Age and Innocence while in Spain. An interview in his personal files specifies that he was in Ibiza, having gone once earlier to visit Mordecai Richler
